result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Michael Shovick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Michael Shovick

records.addlTxt: Remedial Contempt Order

Adam M. Shovick does not appear in Court. Nancy Bergstrom appears for Lincoln County. Cases are called. County is heard. Court makes finding of contempt; orders lump sum payment in the amount of $550 to be paid by December 19, 2018; payment plan in the amount of $100 per month beginning on or before January 15, 2019 and every month thereafter by the 15th until balance is paid in full; 30 days jail STAYED w/Huber for failure to comply with lump sum payment and/or payment plan. Purge will be $1500 if taken into custody or balance if lesser than $1500. Jail as sanction does not satisfy debt.
Notice and Order to Show Cause- Contempt
Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions
